info_content: Information 1: The young man peaking out at the viewer, is none other than Raphael himself.
Information 2: Hypatia, the first woman documented to have made a contribution to mathematics, astronomy and philosophy.
Information 3: Alexander the Great, King of Macedonia in the 4th century B.C. and eventual ruler of the land stretching from Greece to India and Egypt.
Information 4: Pythagoras, an ancient Ionian Greek philosopher, polymath and the eponymous founder of Pythagoreanism.
Information 5: Socrates(the rightest), among the crowd surrounding Socrates are his students, including the general Alcibiades and Aeschines of Sphettus.
Information 6: Heraclitus, a self-taught pioneer of wisdom. He was a melancholy character and did not enjoy the company of others,
Information 7: Euclid, an ancient Greek mathematician active as a geometer and logician.
Information 8: Plato on the left and Aristotle, his student, on the right. Both figures bound copies of their books in their left hands, while gesturing with their right.
